class src.core.Instrument(name=None, settings=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

generic instrument class

for subclass overwrite following old_functions / properties:
  • _settings_default => parameter object, that is a list of parameters that can be set to configure the instrument
  • update => function that sends parameter changes to the instrument
  • values => dictionary that contains all the values that can be read from the instrument
  • get_values => function that actually requests the values from the instrument
  • is_connected => property that checks if instrument is actually connected
__dict__ = dict_proxy({'__module__': 'PyLabControl.src.core.instruments', 'save_b26': <function save_b26 at 0x104a14410>, 'load_and_append': <staticmethod object at 0x104a006e0>, 'update': <function update at 0x104a06e60>, 'read_probes': <function read_probes at 0x104a06f50>, '_DEFAULT_SETTINGS': <function _DEFAULT_SETTINGS at 0x104a06de8>, '__dict__': <attribute '__dict__' of 'Instrument' objects>, '__weakref__': <attribute '__weakref__' of 'Instrument' objects>, '__init__': <function __init__ at 0x104a06d70>, '__setattr__': <function __setattr__ at 0x104a14140>, 'name': <property object at 0x104a02a48>, 'settings': <property object at 0x104a029f0>, '_PROBES': <function _PROBES at 0x104a06ed8>, '__getattr__': <function __getattr__ at 0x104a140c8>, '__repr__': <function __repr__ at 0x104a141b8>, 'is_connected': <property object at 0x104a02998>, '__doc__': '\n generic instrument class\n\n for subclass overwrite following old_functions / properties:\n - _settings_default => parameter object, that is a list of parameters that can be set to configure the instrument\n - update => function that sends parameter changes to the instrument\n - values => dictionary that contains all the values that can be read from the instrument\n - get_values => function that actually requests the values from the instrument\n - is_connected => property that checks if instrument is actually connected\n ', 'to_dict': <function to_dict at 0x104a14398>})¶
__getattr__(name)[source]¶

allows to read instrument inputs in the form value = instrument.input :param name: name of input channel

Returns: value of input channel

__setattr__(key, value)[source]¶

this allows to address instrument outputs of the form instrument.output = value

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

is_connected¶

check if instrument is active and connected and return True in that case :return: bool

static load_and_append(instrument_dict, instruments=None, raise_errors=False)[source]¶

load instrument from instrument_dict and append to instruments

Parameters:
  • instrument_dict –

    dictionary of form

    instrument_dict = { name_of_instrument_1 :

    {“settings” : settings_dictionary, “class” : name_of_class}
    name_of_instrument_2 :
    {“settings” : settings_dictionary, “class” : name_of_class}

    ... }

  • or – instrument_dict = { name_of_instrument_1 : name_of_class, name_of_instrument_2 : name_of_class ... }
  • name_of_class is either a class or a dictionary of the form {class (where) – name_of__class, filepath: path_to_instr_file}
  • instruments –

    dictionary of form

    instruments = { name_of_instrument_1 : instance_of_instrument_1, name_of_instrument_2 : instance_of_instrument_2, ... }

  • raise_errors – if true errors are raised, if False they are caught but not raised
Returns:

dictionary updated_instruments that contains the old and the new instruments

and list loaded_failed = [name_of_instrument_1, name_of_instrument_2, ....] that contains the instruments that were requested but could not be loaded
name¶

Returns: instrument name

function is overloaded:
  • read_probes()
  • read_probes(key)
Parameters:key – name of requested value
Returns:returns the values of all probes in dictionary form - if called with argument: returns the value the requested key
Return type:
  • if called without argument

Returns: the instrument itself as a dictionary

update(settings)[source]¶

updates the internal dictionary and sends changed values to instrument :param settings: parameters to be set

class src.core.Parameter(name, value=None, valid_values=None, info=None, visible=False)[source]¶

Bases: dict

__dict__ = dict_proxy({'info': <property object at 0x104a02ba8>, '__module__': 'PyLabControl.src.core.parameter', 'update': <function update at 0x104a146e0>, 'visible': <property object at 0x10486dd08>, '__setitem__': <function __setitem__ at 0x104a14668>, 'valid_values': <property object at 0x104a02af8>, '__dict__': <attribute '__dict__' of 'Parameter' objects>, '__weakref__': <attribute '__weakref__' of 'Parameter' objects>, '__doc__': None, '__init__': <function __init__ at 0x104a145f0>, 'is_valid': <staticmethod object at 0x104a008a0>})¶
__init__(name, value=None, valid_values=None, info=None, visible=False)[source]¶

Parameter(name, value, valid_values, info) Parameter(name, value, valid_values) Parameter(name, value) Parameter({name: value})

Future updates: Parameter({name1: value1, name2: value2}) Parameter([p1, p2]), where p1 and p2 are parameter objects

Parameters:
  • name – name of parameter
  • value – value of parameter can be any basic type or a list
  • valid_values – defines which values are accepted for value can be a type or a list if not provided => type(value)
  • info – description of parameter, if not provided => empty string
  • visible – boolean if true always show parameter if false hide it
__module__ = 'PyLabControl.src.core.parameter'¶

overwrites the standard dictionary and checks if value is valid :param key: dictionary key :param value: dictionary value

Returns: a text describing the paramter

static is_valid(value, valid_values)[source]¶

check is the value is valid :param value: value to be tested :param valid_values: allowed valid values (type or list of values)

Returns:

update(*args)[source]¶

updates the values of the parameter, just as a regular dictionary

valid_values¶

Returns: valid value of the paramerer (a type like int, float or a list)

visible¶

Returns: if parameter should be shown (False) or hidden (True) in the GUI
